intro: Epilobium lineare f. latifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf willow herb, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy pink to red flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks. It has a prostrate or semi-erect growth habit and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional herbal medicine.
